results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} (-1)^(d + n/d) * d^2.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from G. C. Greubel)
P. Bala, A signed Dirichlet product of arithmetical functions
J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 4 and p. 8).
Index entries for sequences mentioned by Glaisher
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, (-1)^(# + n/#)*#^2 &]; Array[a, 50] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 27 2018 *)
program: (PARI) apply( A321558(n)=sumdiv(n, d, (-1)^(n\d-d)*d^2), [1..30]) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 26 2018
(MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!( (&+[(-1)^(k+1)*k^2*x^k/(1 + x^k) : k in [1..2*m]]) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 28 2018
(Sage) s=(sum((-1)^(k+1)*k^2*x^k/(1 + x^k)  for k in (1..50))).series(x, 30); a = s.coefficients(x, sparse=False); a[1:] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 28 2018
xref: Cf. A321543 - A321557, A321810 - A321836 for similar sequences.
